result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin R. Harcus

defendant.name: Harcus, Benjamin R.
defendant.address: 3200 Water St Trl #53, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:41 a.m. Defendant Benjamin R. Harcus in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF31 and 15CF130.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 15CF31 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 18 mo Prob: $200 + costs+ DNA surcharges.  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Maintain fulltime employment.   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. If successfully completes probation, expungement option.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  15CF130 to be DRI.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 15CF31: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF31 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
  15CF31 Ct 2 and 15CF130 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs in part and requests no fulltime employment condition due to his disability. 20 days credit

BY THE COURT: **********PROBATION****
15CF31 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 
18 mo Prob: 
Conditions
Pay $200 + costs+ DNA surcharges.  Bond to be applied and balance due during term of probation.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
If physically able to work, maintain fulltime employment.   
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
20 days jail credit.
If successfully completes probation, eligible for 973.015 expungement option.

Informed of Appeal rights.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Benjamin R. Harcus in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Benjamin R. Harcus in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Benjamin R. Harcus appeared by video.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

1:15 p.m. (d.o.b.:11-19-1990)
DA #15PT677
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump and Possess Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.  

BTC:  $500 cash bond: Comply with all the bond conditions in 15CF31.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  04-27-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
$500 cash bond: Comply with all the bond conditions in 15CF31.
